###### This Notebook was created to perform delta backup using existing-tables-metadata (ETM). 
###### First lists all the files in the container and filters the delta files based on format from ETM
###### All files minus the delta files gives non-delta files which is sent as dict to a copy activity in the pipeline. 
###### There were inconsistencies in ETM formats hence using another notebook delta_back_odw_validate

import pprint
from pyspark.sql.types import *
import json
import re
from pyspark.sql.functions import col, explode

storage_account: str = mssparkutils.notebook.run('/utils/py_utils_get_storage_account')
metadata_path: str = "abfss://odw-config@"+storage_account+"existing-tables-metadata.json"
df_metadata  = spark.read.json(metadata_path, multiLine=True)

all_file_path_list = []
for i in mssparkutils.fs.ls(full_storage_path):
    all_file_path_list.append(str(i).split("=")[1].split(",")[0])
all_file_path_list = [ x for x in all_file_path_list if "test" not in x ]

# Explode each metadata category separately (as they are nested lists)
standardised_df = df_metadata.select(explode(col("standardised_metadata")).alias("metadata"))
harmonised_df   = df_metadata.select(explode(col("harmonised_metadata")).alias("metadata"))
curated_df      = df_metadata.select(explode(col("curated_metadata")).alias("metadata"))
logging_df      = df_metadata.select(explode(col("logging_metadata")).alias("metadata"))
config_df       = df_metadata.select(explode(col("config_metadata")).alias("metadata"))

# Select the relevant fields
df_exploded = standardised_df.union(harmonised_df).union(curated_df).union(logging_df).union(config_df).selectExpr("metadata.*")
